data.name: AvoidUsingCmdletAliasesDescription
data.value: An alias is an alternate name or nickname for a cmdlet or for a command element, such as a function, script, file, or executable file. But when writing scripts that will potentially need to be maintained over time, either by the original author or another Windows PowerShell scripter, please consider using full cmdlet name instead of alias. Aliases can introduce these problems, readability, understandability and availability.

data.name: AvoidUsingCmdletAliasesCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Cmdlet Aliases

data.name: AvoidUsingEmptyCatchBlockDescription
data.value: Empty catch blocks are considered poor design decisions because if an error occurs in the try block, this error is simply swallowed and not acted upon. While this does not inherently lead to bad things. It can and this should be avoided if possible. To fix a violation of this rule, using Write-Error or throw statements in catch blocks.

data.name: AvoidUsingEmptyCatchBlockCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Empty Catch Block

data.name: AvoidUsingInvokeExpressionRuleDescription
data.value: The Invoke-Expression cmdlet evaluates or runs a specified string as a command and returns the results of the expression or command. It can be extraordinarily powerful so it is not that you want to never use it but you need to be very careful about using it. In particular, you are probably on safe ground if the data only comes from the program itself. If you include any data provided from the user - you need to protect yourself from Code Injection. To fix a violation of this rule, please remove Invoke-Expression from script and find other options instead.

data.name: AvoidUsingInvokeExpressionRuleCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Invoke-Expression

data.name: AvoidUsingPositionalParametersDescription
data.value: Readability and clarity should be the goal of any script we expect to maintain over time. When calling a command that takes parameters, where possible consider using name parameters as opposed to positional parameters. To fix a violation of this rule, please use named parameters instead of positional parameters when calling a command.

data.name: AvoidUsingPositionalParametersCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Positional Parameters

data.name: ProvideCommentHelpDescription
data.value: Checks that all cmdlets have a help comment. This rule only checks existence. It does not check the content of the comment.

data.name: ProvideCommentHelpError
data.value: The cmdlet '{0}' does not have a help comment.

data.name: ProvideCommentHelpCommonName
data.value: Basic Comment Help

data.name: UseApprovedVerbsDescription
data.value: Checks that all defined cmdlets use approved verbs. This is in line with PowerShell's best practices.

data.name: UseApprovedVerbsError
data.value: The cmdlet '{0}' uses an unapproved verb.

data.name: UseApprovedVerbsCommonName
data.value: Cmdlet Verbs

data.name: UseDeclaredVarsMoreThanAssignmentsDescription
data.value: Checks that variables are used in more than just their assignment. Generally this is a red flag that a variable is not needed. This rule does not check if the assignment and usage are in the same function.

data.name: UseDeclaredVarsMoreThanAssignmentsError
data.value: The variable '{0}' is assigned but never used.

data.name: UseDeclaredVarsMoreThanAssignmentsCommonName
data.value: Extra Variables

data.name: AvoidUninitializedVariableDescription
data.value: Non-global variables must be initialized. To fix a violation of this rule, please initialize non-global variables.

data.name: AvoidUninitializedVariableCommonName
data.value: Initializing non-global variables

data.name: AvoidGlobalVarsDescription
data.value: Checks that global variables are not used. Global variables are strongly discouraged as they can cause errors across different systems.

data.name: AvoidGlobalVarsError
data.value: Found global variable '{0}'.

data.name: AvoidGlobalVarsCommonName
data.value: No Global Variables

data.name: AvoidTrapStatementDescription
data.value: Avoid using Traps in the script.

data.name: AvoidTrapStatementError
data.value: Trap found.

data.name: AvoidTrapStatementCommonName
data.value: No traps in the script.

data.name: PossibleIncorrectComparisonWithNullDescription
data.value: Checks that $null is on the left side of any equaltiy comparisons (eq, ne, ceq, cne, ieq, ine). When there is an array on the left side of a null equality comparison, PowerShell will check for a $null IN the array rather than if the array is null. If the two sides of the comaprision are switched this is fixed. Therefore, $null should always be on the left side of equality comparisons just in case.

data.name: PossibleIncorrectComparisonWithNullError
data.value: $null should be on the left side of equality comparisons.

data.name: PossibleIncorrectComparisonWithNullCommonName
data.value: Null Comparison

data.name: OneCharDescription
data.value: Checks that cmdlets and parameters have more than one character.

data.name: OneCharErrorCmdlet
data.value: The cmdlet name '{0}' only has one character.

data.name: OneCharErrorParameter
data.value: The cmdlet '{0}' has a parameter '{1}' that only has one character.

data.name: OneCharErrorParameterSB
data.value: A script block has a parameter '{0}' that only has one character.

data.name: OneCharCommonName
data.value: One Char

data.name: UsePSCredentialTypeDescription
data.value: Checks that cmdlets that have a Credential parameter accept PSCredential. This comes from the PowerShell teams best practices.

data.name: UsePSCredentialTypeError
data.value: The Credential parameter in '{0}' must be of the type PSCredential.

data.name: UsePSCredentialTypeErrorSB
data.value: The Credential parameter in a found script block must be of the type PSCredential.

data.name: UsePSCredentialTypeCommonName
data.value: PSCredential

data.name: ReservedCmdletCharDescription
data.value: Checks for reserved characters in cmdlet names. These characters usually cause a parsing error. Otherwise they will generally cause runtime errors.

data.name: ReservedCmdletCharError
data.value: The cmdlet '{0}' uses a reserved char in its name.

data.name: ReservedCmdletCharCommonName
data.value: Reserved Cmdlet Chars

data.name: ReservedParamsCmdletPrefix
data.value: The cmdlet '{0}'

data.name: ReservedParamsDescription
data.value: Checks for reserved parameters in function definitions. If these parameters are defined by the user, an error generally occurs.

data.name: ReservedParamsError
data.value: '{0}' defines the reserved common parameter '{1}'.

data.name: ReservedParamsCommonName
data.value: Reserved Parameters

data.name: ReservedParamsScriptPrefix
data.value: The script

data.name: ShouldProcessDescription
data.value: Checks that if the SupportsShouldProcess is present, the function calls ShouldProcess/ShouldContinue and vice versa. Scripts with one or the other but not both will generally run into an error or unexpected behavior.

data.name: ShouldProcessErrorHasAttribute
data.value: '{0}' has the ShouldProcess attribute but does not call ShouldProcess/ShouldContinue.

data.name: ShouldProcessErrorHasAttributeSB
data.value: A script block has the ShouldProcess attribute but does not call ShouldProcess/ShouldContinue.

data.name: ShouldProcessErrorHasCmdlet
data.value: '{0}' calls ShouldProcess/ShouldContinue but does not have the ShouldProcess attribute.

data.name: ShouldProcessErrorHasCmdletSB
data.value: A script block calls ShouldProcess/ShouldContinue but does not have the ShouldProcess attribute.

data.name: ShouldProcessCommonName
data.value: Should Process

data.name: SourceName
data.value: PS

data.name: ProvideVerboseMessageDescription
data.value: Checks that Write-Verbose is called at least once in every cmdlet or script. This is in line with the PowerShell best practices.

data.name: ProvideVerboseMessageErrorFunction
data.value: There is no call to Write-Verbose in the function ‘{0}’.

data.name: ProvideVerboseMessageCommonName
data.value: Verbose

data.name: ProvideVerboseMessageScript
data.value: There is no call to Write-Verbose in the script.

data.name: MissingModuleManifestFieldDescription
data.value: Some fields of the module manifest (such as ModuleVersion) are required.

data.name: MissingModuleManifestFieldCommonName
data.value: Module Manifest Fields

data.name: AvoidUnloadableModuleDescription
data.value: If a script file is in a Powershell module folder, then that folder must be loadable.

data.name: AvoidUnloadableModuleError
data.value: Cannot load the module '{0}' that file '{1}' is in.

data.name: AvoidUnloadableModuleCommonName
data.value: Module Must Be Loadable

data.name: AvoidUsingFilePathDescription
data.value: If a rooted file path is used in a script that is published online, this may expose information about your computer. Furthermore, the file path may not work on other computer when they try to use the script.

data.name: AvoidUsingFilePathError
data.value: The file path '{0}' of '{1}' is rooted. This should be avoided if '{1}' is published online.

data.name: AvoidUsingFilePathCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using File Path

data.name: NullErrorMessage
data.value: Error Message is Null.

data.name: AvoidUsingPlainTextForPasswordDescription
data.value: Password parameters that take in plaintext will expose passwords and compromise the security of your system.

data.name: AvoidUsingPlainTextForPasswordError
data.value: Parameter '{0}' should use SecureString, otherwise this will expose sensitive information. See ConvertTo-SecureString for more information.

data.name: AvoidUsingPlainTextForPasswordCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Plain Text For Password Parameter

data.name: AvoidUsingConvertToSecureStringWithPlainTextDescription
data.value: Using ConvertTo-SecureString with plain text will expose secure information.

data.name: AvoidUsingConvertToSecureStringWithPlainTextError
data.value: File '{0}' uses ConvertTo-SecureString with plaintext. This will expose secure information. Encrypted standard strings should be used instead.

data.name: AvoidUsingConvertToSecureStringWithPlainTextCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using SecureString With Plain Text

data.name: AvoidDefaultValueSwitchParameterDescription
data.value: Switch parameter should not default to true.

data.name: AvoidDefaultValueSwitchParameterError
data.value: File '{0}' has a switch parameter default to true.

data.name: AvoidDefaultValueSwitchParameterCommonName
data.value: Switch Parameters Should Not Default To True

data.name: AvoidShouldContinueShouldProcessWithoutForceDescription
data.value: Functions that use ShouldContinue or ShouldProcess should have a boolean force parameter to allow user to bypass it.

data.name: AvoidShouldContinueShouldProcessWithoutForceError
data.value: Function '{0}' in file '{1}' uses ShouldContinue or ShouldProcess but does not have a boolean force parameter. The force parameter will allow users of the script to bypass ShouldContinue prompt

data.name: AvoidShouldContinueShouldProcessWithoutForceCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using ShouldContinue Or ShouldProcess Without Boolean Force Parameter

data.name: AvoidUsingClearHostDescription
data.value: Using Clear-Host is not recommended because the cmdlet may not work in some hosts or there may even be no hosts at all.

data.name: AvoidUsingClearHostError
data.value: File '{0}' uses Clear-Host. This is not recommended because it may not work in some hosts or there may even be no hosts at all.

data.name: AvoidUsingClearHostCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Clear-Host

data.name: AvoidUsingConsoleWriteError
data.value: File '{0}' uses Console.'{1}'. Using Console to write is not recommended because it may not work in all hosts or there may even be no hosts at all. Use Write-Output instead.

data.name: AvoidUsingWriteHostDescription
data.value: Write-Host or Console.Write should not be used because it may not work in some hosts or there may even be no hosts at all. Use Write-Output instead.

data.name: AvoidUsingWriteHostError
data.value: File '{0}' uses Write-Host. This is not recommended because it may not work in some hosts or there may even be no hosts at all. Use Write-Output instead.

data.name: AvoidUsingWriteHostCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Write-Host

data.name: UseSingularNounsDescription
data.value: Cmdlet should use singular instead of plural nouns.

data.name: UseSingularNounsError
data.value: The cmdlet '{0}' uses a plural noun. A singular noun should be used instead.

data.name: UseSingularNounsCommonName
data.value: Cmdlet Singular Noun

data.name: AvoidUsingCmdletAliasesName
data.value: AvoidUsingCmdletAliases

data.name: AvoidDefaultValueSwitchParameterName
data.value: AvoidDefaultValueSwitchParameter

data.name: AvoidGlobalVarsName
data.value: AvoidGlobalVars

data.name: AvoidShouldContinueShouldProcessWithoutForceName
data.value: AvoidShouldContinueShouldProcessWithoutForce

data.name: AvoidTrapStatementName
data.value: AvoidTrapStatement

data.name: AvoidUninitializedVariableName
data.value: AvoidUninitializedVariable

data.name: AvoidUnloadableModuleName
data.value: AvoidUnloadableModule

data.name: AvoidUsingClearHostName
data.value: AvoidUsingClearHost

data.name: AvoidUsingConvertToSecureStringWithPlainTextName
data.value: AvoidUsingConvertToSecureStringWithPlainText

data.name: AvoidUsingEmptyCatchBlockName
data.value: AvoidUsingEmptyCatchBlock

data.name: AvoidUsingFilePathName
data.value: AvoidUsingFilePath

data.name: AvoidUsingInvokeExpressionRuleName
data.value: AvoidUsingInvokeExpression

data.name: AvoidUsingPlainTextForPasswordName
data.value: AvoidUsingPlainTextForPassword

data.name: AvoidUsingPositionalParametersName
data.value: AvoidUsingPositionalParameters

data.name: AvoidUsingWriteHostName
data.value: AvoidUsingWriteHost

data.name: OneCharName
data.value: OneChar

data.name: PossibleIncorrectComparisonWithNullName
data.value: PossibleIncorrectComparisonWithNull

data.name: ProvideCommentHelpName
data.value: ProvideCommentHelp

data.name: ReservedCmdletCharName
data.value: ReservedCmdletChar

data.name: ReservedParamsName
data.value: ReservedParams

data.name: ShouldProcessName
data.value: ShouldProcess

data.name: UseApprovedVerbsName
data.value: UseApprovedVerbs

data.name: UseDeclaredVarsMoreThanAssignmentsName
data.value: UseDeclaredVarsMoreThanAssigments

data.name: UsePSCredentialTypeName
data.value: UsePSCredentialType

data.name: UseSingularNounsName
data.value: UseSingularNouns

data.name: MissingModuleManifestFieldName
data.value: MissingModuleManifestField

data.name: ProvideVerboseMessageName
data.value: ProvideVerboseMessage

data.name: CommandNotFoundCommonName
data.value: Command Not Found

data.name: CommandNotFoundDescription
data.value: Commands that are undefined or do not exist should not be used.

data.name: CommandNotFoundError
data.value: Command '{0}' Is Not Found

data.name: CommandNotFoundName
data.value: CommandNotFound

data.name: TypeNotFoundCommonName
data.value: Type Not Found

data.name: TypeNotFoundDescription
data.value: Undefined type should not be used

data.name: TypeNotFoundError
data.value: Type '{0}' is not found. Please check that it is defined.

data.name: TypeNotFoundName
data.value: TypeNotFound

data.name: UseCmdletCorrectlyCommonName
data.value: Use Cmdlet Correctly

data.name: UseCmdletCorrectlyDescription
data.value: Cmdlet should be called with the mandatory parameters.

data.name: UseCmdletCorrectlyError
data.value: Cmdlet '{0}' may be used incorrectly. Please check that all mandatory parameters are supplied.

data.name: UseCmdletCorrectlyName
data.value: UseCmdletCorrectly

data.name: UseTypeAtVariableAssignmentCommonName
data.value: Use Type At Variable Assignment

data.name: UseTypeAtVariableAssignmentDescription
data.value: Types should be specified at variable assignments to maintain readability and maintainability of script.

data.name: UseTypeAtVariableAssignmentError
data.value: Specify type at the assignment of variable '{0}'

data.name: UseTypeAtVariableAssignmentName
data.value: UseTypeAtVariableAssignment

data.name: AvoidUserNameAndPasswordParamsCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Username and Password Parameters

data.name: AvoidUserNameAndPasswordParamsDescription
data.value: Functions should only take in a credential parameter of type PSCredential instead of username and password parameters.

data.name: AvoidUserNameAndPasswordParamsError
data.value: Function '{0}' has both username and password parameters. A credential parameter of type PSCredential should be used.

data.name: AvoidUserNameAndPasswordParamsName
data.value: AvoidUsingUserNameAndPassWordParams

data.name: AvoidInvokingEmptyMembersCommonName
data.value: Avoid Invoking Empty Members

data.name: AvoidInvokingEmptyMembersDescription
data.value: Invoking non-constant members would cause potential bugs. Please double check the syntax to make sure members invoked are non-constant.

data.name: AvoidInvokingEmptyMembersError
data.value: '{0}' has non-constant members. Invoking empty members may cause bugs in the script.

data.name: AvoidInvokingEmptyMembersName
data.value: AvoidInvokingEmptyMembers

data.name: AvoidComputerNameHardcodedCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using ComputerName Hardcoded

data.name: AvoidComputerNameHardcodedDescription
data.value: The ComputerName parameter of a cmdlet should not be hardcoded as this will expose sensitive information about the system.

data.name: AvoidComputerNameHardcodedError
data.value: The ComputerName parameter of cmdlet '{0}' is hardcoded. This will expose sensitive information about the system if the script is shared.

data.name: AvoidComputerNameHardcodedName
data.value: AvoidUsingComputerNameHardcoded

data.name: AvoidEmptyCatchBlockError
data.value: Empty catch block is used. Please use Write-Error or throw statements in catch blocks.

data.name: AvoidUsingCmdletAliasesError
data.value: '{0}' is an alias of '{1}'. Alias can introduce possible problems and make scripts hard to maintain. Please consider changing alias to its full content.

data.name: AvoidUsingInvokeExpressionError
data.value: Invoke-Expression is used. Please remove Invoke-Expression from script and find other options instead.

data.name: AvoidUsingPositionalParametersError
data.value: Cmdlet '{0}' has positional parameter. Please use named parameters instead of positional parameters when calling a command.

data.name: NullAstErrorMessage
data.value: Cannot process null Ast

data.name: NullCommandInfoError
data.value: Cannot process null CommandInfo

data.name: DSCSourceName
data.value: PSDSC

data.name: UseStandardDSCFunctionsInResourceCommonName
data.value: Use Standard Get/Set/Test TargetResource functions in DSC Resource

data.name: UseStandardDSCFunctionsInResourceDescription
data.value: DSC Resource must implement Get, Set and Test-TargetResource functions. DSC Class must implement Get, Set and Test functions.

data.name: UseStandardDSCFunctionsInResourceError
data.value: Missing '{0}' function. DSC Resource must implement Get, Set and Test-TargetResource functions.

data.name: UseStandardDSCFunctionsInResourceName
data.value: StandardDSCFunctionsInResource

data.name: AvoidUsingInternalURLsCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Internal URLs

data.name: AvoidUsingInternalURLsDescription
data.value: Using Internal URLs in the scripts may cause security problems.

data.name: AvoidUsingInternalURLsError
data.value: '{0}' could be an internal URL. Using internal URL directly in the script may cause potential information discloure.

data.name: AvoidUsingInternalURLsName
data.value: AvoidUsingInternalURLs

data.name: SharepointURL
data.value: www.sharepoint.com

data.name: UseIdenticalParametersDSCCommonName
data.value: Use Identical Parameters For DSC Test and Set Functions

data.name: UseIdenticalParametersDSCDescription
data.value: The Test and Set-TargetResource functions of DSC Resource must have the same parameters.

data.name: UseIdenticalParametersDSCError
data.value: The Test and Set-TargetResource functions of DSC Resource must have the same parameters.

data.name: UseIdenticalParametersDSCName
data.value: UseIdenticalParametersForDSC

data.name: UseStandardDSCFunctionsInClassError
data.value: Missing '{0}' function. DSC Class must implement Get, Set and Test functions.

data.name: AvoidUninitializedVariableError
data.value: Variable '{0}' is not initialized. Non-global variables must be initialized. To fix a violation of this rule, please initialize non-global variables.

data.name: UseIdenticalMandatoryParametersDSCCommonName
data.value: Use identical mandatory parameters for DSC Get/Test/Set TargetResource functions

data.name: UseIdenticalMandatoryParametersDSCDescription
data.value: The Get/Test/Set TargetResource functions of DSC resource must have the same mandatory parameters.

data.name: UseIdenticalMandatoryParametersDSCError
data.value: The mandatory parameter '{0}' is not present in '{1}' DSC resource function(s).

data.name: UseIdenticalMandatoryParametersDSCName
data.value: UseIdenticalMandatoryParametersForDSC
